page.title: 11Cycle Training
page.content: Cycle Proficiency Training has become an annual event for the Fourth Year pupils of Severnbanks School. Once carried out by the police, the lessons are now given by senior pupils and their teacher from nearby Whitecross Comprehensive School. The course begins with the cycles being checked for roadworthiness. This includes brakes, tyres, chain and saddle height. Next comes riding skills such as riding in and out lines of cones and emergency stops. Signals to other road users is the next important habit to be practised. After several lessons comes a mock test followed by the real one. This includes a written test on the Highway Code which we have to learn at home. Finally if we have been successful comes the award of the Cycling Proficiency Certificate and badges.
